extracted_text.text: Medical Software Requirements
1. Introduction

This document outlines the functional and non-functional requirements for the medical software application. The software is designed to streamline patient management, scheduling, and electronic health records (EHR) for clinics and hospitals. It will be a secure, web-based platform accessible to authorized medical staff.
2. Functional Requirements

User Management: The system must allow for the creation, editing, and deactivation of user accounts with specific roles (e.g., Doctor, Nurse, Administrator). Each role will have defined access permissions.

Patient Records: The software must allow for the creation and management of electronic patient records, including demographics, medical history, diagnoses, allergies, and medication history. All information must be time-stamped with the user who made the entry.

Appointment Scheduling: The system must include a calendar-based interface for scheduling, rescheduling, and canceling patient appointments. It must send automated reminders to patients via email or SMS.
Prescription Management: The software must enable doctors to generate electronic prescriptions, check for potential drug-drug interactions, and securely send prescriptions to pharmacies.
Reporting: The system must be able to generate reports on patient demographics, appointment trends, and billing summaries to assist in clinic administration.
3. Non-functional Requirements

Security: The system must comply with HIPAA regulations. All patient data must be encrypted both at rest and in transit. The system must include a robust access control mechanism and a detailed audit trail of all data access and modifications.
Performance: The system must load patient records and reports within three seconds under typical usage conditions.
Usability: The user interface must be intuitive and easy to navigate for medical professionals with minimal training.
Reliability: The system must have a guaranteed uptime of 99.9%.
Medical Software Requirements
1. Introduction

This document outlines the functional and non-functional requirements for the medical
software application. The software is designed to streamline patient management,
scheduling, and electronic health records (EHR) for clinics and hospitals. It will be a
secure, web-based platform accessible to authorized medical staff.

deactivation of user accounts with specific roles (e.g., Doctor, Nurse,
Administrator). Each role will have defined access permissions.

Patient Records: The software must allow for the creation and management of
electronic patient records, including demographics, medical history, diagnoses,
allergies, and medication history. All information must be time-stamped with the
user who made the entry.

Appointment Scheduling: The system must include a calendar-based interface
for scheduling, rescheduling, and canceling patient appointments. It must send
automated reminders to patients via email or SMS.
Prescription Management: The software must enable doctors to generate

electronic prescriptions, check for potential drug-drug interactions, and securely

Security: The system must comply with HIPAA regulations. All patient data must

Performance: The system must load patient records and reports within three

professionals with minimal training.
Reliability: The system must have a guaranteed uptime of 99.9%.
